metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9037 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 3.7.5, 3.8.x before 3.8.5, 3.9.x before 3.9.3, and 4.xbefore 4.0.1 might allow remote attackers to obtain access to an accountidle since 2008 by leveraging an improper PHP dynamic type comparison foran MD5 hash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9037` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1+dfsg-1').
